last_episode_to_air.name: The Elevated Woman
last_episode_to_air.overview: On their way to the Women's Liberation meeting, which Donald reluctantly agrees to visit, Ann and Donald become trapped in a stuck elevator. While they await to be rescued, they look back on their favorite moments together.

name: That Girl
overview: That Girl is an American sitcom that ran on ABC from 1966 to 1971. It stars Marlo Thomas as the title character Ann Marie, an aspiring actress, who moves from her hometown of Brewster, New York to try to make it big in New York City. Ann has to take a number of offbeat "temp" jobs to support herself in between her various auditions and bit parts. Ted Bessell played her boyfriend Donald Hollinger, a writer for Newsview Magazine; Lew Parker and Rosemary DeCamp played Lew Marie and Helen Marie, her concerned parents. Bernie Kopell, Ruth Buzzi and Reva Rose played Ann and Donald's friends. That Girl was developed by writers Bill Persky and Sam Denoff, who had served as head writers on The Dick Van Dyke Show earlier in the 1960s.

episodes.name: Test Pilot - What's in a Name
episodes.overview: In this test pilot, Ann's parents are played by different actors, Ted Bessell plays Don Blue Sky, her agent who is also her boyfriend, and Ann has a group of three girlfriends. Don thinks that Ann should change her name from Ann Marie to a more suitable stage name because every time he tells people her name, they ask "'Ann Marie' what?". Ann is hesitant because she knows that it would upset her parents, particularly her father. As she predicted, her father becomes very angry and will not speak to her unless she keeps her name. This episode was later changed to include the different actors and characters, and is episode 1.11 of the first season.

episodes.name: Don't Just Do Something, Stand There
episodes.overview: Ann's five years of being an independent woman actress begins when she meets Donald Hollinger, a magazine reporter, in one of her in-between jobs as a candy clerk. She gets a job in a perfume commercial where she plays a woman who gets kidnapped by two robbers. Donald happens to see the act and thinks that Ann is in real trouble, so he saves her only to get serious flack from her. But with that incident aside, Ann and Donald find out that they really belong together.

episodes.name: Goodbye, Hello, Goodbye
episodes.overview: Ann Marie leaves the safety and comfort of her parent's home to live on her own in New York. But she has a visit from her mother who is threatening to move in with her!

episodes.name: Never Change a Diaper on Opening Night
episodes.overview: Ann has a chance to audition for Jules Benedict, but has to babysit Leon and Judy's baby as well. Will Ann be able to pull this off?

episodes.name: I'll Be Suing You
episodes.overview: Ann has to go to court because of an accident involving a pedestrian and a sewing machine.

episodes.name: Anatomy of a Blunder
episodes.overview: Ann brings Donald home to meet her parents, but he goes through some serious torture when they stop for a little picnic on the way.

episodes.name: Rich Little Rich Kid
episodes.overview: Ann is charmed by a wealthy man who gives her many luxuries and Don tries to compete. Ann realizes that money is not the most important thing in a relationship.

episodes.name: Help Wanted
episodes.overview: One rule in life: never ever ask your girlfriend to work with you. Don learns that the hard way when he hires Ann to be his secretary.

episodes.name: Little Auction Annie
episodes.overview: At an antique auction, Ann buys a box of junk with a baseball in it. A strange man follows her because he wants the baseball. It turns out that he is an ex-baseball player who wants the ball for sentimental reasons.

episodes.name: Time for Arrest
episodes.overview: Ann ends up in jail trying to help a fellow waitress when she serves two rival underworld groups and the place gets raided by the police.

episodes.name: Break a Leg
episodes.overview: Ann's friend Sandy, an actress who has just won a lead role in a Broadway play, visits Ann. Suddenly, Sandy gets sick, leaving Ann to play her role. Everyone thinks that Ann stole teh job from her, but Ann pays them no never mind as she enjoys her chance. Unfortunately the play closes after one performance.

episodes.name: What's in a Name?
episodes.overview: Ann's agent thinks that she needs a new name for an excellent acting career.

episodes.name: Soap Gets in Your Eyes
episodes.overview: Donald's parents meet Ann for the first time, and his mother Mildred takes a dislike to Ann because she plays a vamp on a soap opera.

episodes.name: All About Ann
episodes.overview: Ann thinks she will lose her sweet Donald to a famous actress when all the time, he is interviewing her for his article.

episodes.name: Phantom of the Horse Opera
episodes.overview: Ann and Donald find a strange organ player who used to play the soundtrack in silent movies. Donald does a story about him, but he disappears because he is a wanted criminal.

episodes.name: Beware of Actors Bearing Gifts
episodes.overview: Ann is being given presents by one of her acting class colleagues, Hobart Niles. She and Donald think that these gifts are hot, but they find out that Hobart is very wealthy.

episodes.name: Christmas and the Hard-Luck Kid
episodes.overview: This very touching Christmas episode has Ann telling Donald about a time where she was a teacher and had to keep a lonely boy company on Christmas when his parents cannot get him.

episodes.name: Among My Souvenirs
episodes.overview: Ann finds souvenirs that remind her of a boyfriend she used to have named Freddy. It turns out that Freddy still has a flame burning for her.

episodes.name: These Boots Weren't Made For Walking
episodes.overview: Ann is a salesperson for shoes that somehow fall apart over time.

episodes.name: Kimomo My House
episodes.overview: Ann hires a maid for Donald, but who she hired makes her jealous.

episodes.name: Gone With the Breeze
episodes.overview: Donald gives Ann a manuscript of a novel that he is writing, and she loses it. Donald is waiting for a response, but Ann stalls because she did not want to admit that she lost it.

episodes.name: Rain, Snow and Rice
episodes.overview: Ann and Donald are invited by their friends, Jerry Bauman and Margie, to a private wedding in Connecticut, but they get snowed in. There are only two rooms available in the inn that they are staying and the boys share one room and the girls share another. The problem begins with Jerry and Margie decide to stay together leaving Ann and Donald in a room together, much to the chagrin of Ann's parents.

episodes.name: Paper Hats and Everything
episodes.overview: Ann thinks that her friends are going to surprise her with a birthday party when she is invited out to dinner by her father.

episodes.name: What Are Your Intentions?
episodes.overview: Lou thinks that Ann and Donald ought to be married, but they have different ideas.

episodes.name: A Tenor's Loving Care
episodes.overview: Ann helps Donald get a story about a famous opera singer, if only he can control his romantic urges.

episodes.name: Leaving the Nest is For the Birds
episodes.overview: Ann invites her parents and her Aunt Harriet to dinner at her house where she tries to prove to them that living in the city is pretty cool. A stranger outside the window ruins Ann's point because he has romantic woes.

episodes.name: You Have to Know Someone to Be Unknown
episodes.overview: Ann reads that a famous producer is looking for an unknown for his play and has Donald put in a good word for her. He tries to tell her that the producer had found his star a long time ago, but she doesn't listen.

episodes.name: The Honeymoon Apartment
episodes.overview: Ann gets a visit from her cheap cousin and his bride. When he refuses to leave, Ann gets a room in a bridal suite to formualte a plan to get him out.

episodes.name: This Little Piggy Had a Ball
episodes.overview: Ann has her toe stuck in a bowling ball at a very unopportune moment.

episodes.name: Author, Author
episodes.overview: Ann needs some funny material for an audition and enlists Donald's writing expertise, but his jokes aren't funny.

episodes.name: The Mating Game
episodes.overview: Donald has to do a story on the show ""The Mating Game"", and he has Ann be a contestant. Ann doesn't know that Donald is one of the bachelors and she picks another man. While she had her date with this man, Donald tags along to get a story.

episodes.name: Pass the Potatoes, Ethel Merman
episodes.overview: Ann is overwhelmed to find herself on stage with Ethel Merman, who chooses Ann for a walk-on part in a revival of ""Gypsy.""

episodes.name: The Good Skate
episodes.overview: Ann makes a valiant effort to learn to roller-skate to get a part in a soft-drink commercial.

episodes.name: Black, White and Read All Over
episodes.overview: Donald, the proud owner of an unpublished novel, needs cheering when he gets his twelfth rejection slip. Ann's father makes connections with a publisher for Don's book, but he reads it himself and refuses to send it in.

episodes.name: To Each her Own
episodes.overview: Donald does a story on computer dating. Ann is jealous when Donald's Compudate match turns out to be attractive model, Lisa Stevens. So Ann fills out a Compudate card herself and comes up with a good-looking date also, who turns out to be a lot more like Donald than she'd care to admit!

episodes.name: The Apartment
episodes.overview: Ann gets a job in telephone marketing at the same time her apartment is being painted, so Ann must borrow Donald's apartment whiel he is away to work in. Dan's friend Harry comes by unknowingly and decides to stay in the apartment as well.

episodes.name: Absence Makes the Heart Grow Fonder (1)
episodes.overview: Ann Marie's elation at winning a Broadway role fades when she realizes its Philadelphia opening will mean a long separation from Donald.

episodes.name: The Philadelphia Story (2)
episodes.overview: Despite attention from a fellow castmate, Ann misses Donald while in Philadelphia to do a play.

episodes.name: There's Nothing to Be Afreud of But Freud Himself
episodes.overview: After a meeting with a famous doctor, Donald uses what he has learned to find out all out Ann's personality.

episodes.name: The Collaborators
episodes.overview: Ann and Donald learn that a couple that works together also fights together when they collaborate on a play about her life.

episodes.name: When in Rome
episodes.overview: Ann wins a part in an Italian movie, but turns it down when she discovers a nude scene.

episodes.name: Thanksgiving Comes But One a Year, Hopefully
episodes.overview: The Hollingers are upset that their son isn't coming home for Thanksgiving, and the Maries are upset that a family tradition is being broken. Trying to cook everyone's favorite dishes, Ann takes over the kitchen of a neighbor who is away. The dinner turns out to be a disaster!

episodes.name: The Mailman Cometh
episodes.overview: While modeling at a famous restaurant, Ann meets an agent named Seymour who gets her a date with Dick Shawn as a publicity stunt, but he doesn't know about it!

episodes.name: It's a Mod, Mod World (1)
episodes.overview: Ann meets a fashion photographer named Noel Prince, whom Donald dislikes. Noel wants to take her to California to do a shoot.

episodes.name: It's a Mod, Mod World (2)
episodes.overview: Noel falls for Ann badly. Don sees a newspaper photo of Ann and Noel being arrested for frolicking in a fountain, he's on the next plane to Los Angeles.

episodes.name: 'Twas the Night before Christmas, You're Under Arrest
episodes.overview: Ann purchases tickets for the Baumans from a scalper. Giving the scalper a check with her address on it and saying the tickets are for her neighbors, she fears they may be robbed (on Christmas Eve). In order to prevent a robbery, Ann and Donald remove all the valuables from the Baumans' apartment, only to be caught by the police.

episodes.name: A Friend in Need
episodes.overview: When Ann sprains her ankle at work, Donald comes to the rescue cooking gourmet meals and cleaning her apartment with a vengeance.

episodes.name: Fur All We Know
episodes.overview: A fortune hunter named Buzzy has his eyes on Ann when she wears a borrowed chinchilla stole to wear at an elite party.

episodes.name: The Rivals
episodes.overview: Ann takes boyfriend Donald home to spend the weekend with her parents, only to find that her father is jealous of Don and sees him as a rival.

episodes.name: Sixty-Five on the Aisle
episodes.overview: After Ann invites her parents to see her Broadway debut, she learns that her lines have been cut considerably. Ann asks her father to change his reservations to the following night so he can see her uncut role. She's unaware that her part was cut to accommodate a surprise theater party planned by her father.

episodes.name: Call of the Wild
episodes.overview: Ann becomes convinced that she has no sex appeal when she lands a part as the Creamy Soap Girl because the producer sees her as a fresh scrubbed face that no housewife could resent for her looks.

episodes.name: The Other Woman
episodes.overview: Lou escorts Ethel Merman just to be nice, and the publicity thinks that they are an item much to Helen's dismay.

episodes.name: He and She and He
episodes.overview: Donald is stunned when Ann receives a marriage proposal from British fashion photographer Noel Prince. Noel expects his answer in the morning, despite Ann's protestations that she loves Donald.

episodes.name: Odpdypahimcaifss
episodes.overview: Mrs. Hollister stays at Ann's apartment and finds a pair of her son's pants hanging in Ann's closet.

episodes.name: Great Guy
episodes.overview: Marge tells Ann that she has met the man of her dreams, but he backs out when she proposed marraige.

episodes.name: The Detective Story
episodes.overview: Ann gets obscene phone calls and a police chief is called to stay with her. Donald thinks that there is something going on between the two of them when he comes out of Ann's bedroom one morning.

episodes.name: If You Were Almost the Only Man in the World
episodes.overview: Ann is knocked out by a baseball and the doctor that treats her looks exactly like Donald.

episodes.name: Just Spell the Name Right
episodes.overview: Ann is pressured to hire unscrupulous press agent Eddie Edwards who promptly links her to a divorce scandal with actor Buddy Hobart in the hopes that it will boost Ann's career.

episodes.name: The Beard
episodes.overview: Ann dislikes Donald's new beard and takes measures to get him to shave it off.

episodes.name: The Drunkard
episodes.overview: A drunk comedian named Marty is taken in by Ann to sober up, and he thinks that they had an affair.

episodes.name: Old Man's Darling
episodes.overview: Ann meets an elderly man, Andrew Washington at a party when he accidentally spills his shrimp cocktail on her new white crepe dress. He tries to make it up to her by giving her gifts, but Ann cannot accept them.

episodes.name: Sock It to Me
episodes.overview: Against the objections of the director, Ann is awarded a part in a Broadway play by the star, Barry Sullivan. Ann is excited to get this opportunity, but when the script calls for Ann to slap Barry, she can't bring herself to do it.

episodes.name: The Hi-Jack and the Mighty
episodes.overview: Ann works as a flight attendant to get a job for an airline commercial. Ann thinks that a man is going to hijack the plane and she tackles him. She then discovers that he is a detective hired to prevent hijackings!

episodes.name: Eleven Angry Men and That Girl
episodes.overview: Ann takes her jury duty to heart and will not go along with the rest of the panel when they all want to vote ""guilty"" against a man accused of hitting his wife with an ashtray. After reasoning that he couldn't have hit her with his right hand, she convinces the others and they vote for acquittal.
Ann goes with Donald to Los Angeles to do a story on media violence and causes confusion for her father and everyone else who thinks that they are getting it on.
Whiel in Los Angeles, Ann gets a job in action commercials for soda-pop, and Donald hates them because it is the very thing that he is going against.

episodes.name: Secret Ballot
episodes.overview: Ann is excited at the prospect of voting in her first presidential election. She's gone to the library to read everything she can about the issues and the political process. But on Halloween night, when Ann's father asks her what party she registered with, Ann feels it's her right to preserve her secret ballot.

episodes.name: The Face in the Shower Room Door
episodes.overview: Ann gets stuck in a shower and a new neighbor helps her to get out.

episodes.name: A Muggy Day in Central Park
episodes.overview: Ann is mugged and tries her best not to let her father find out about it. Donald gets into the act by dressing up as a woman to catch muggers to do a story for his magazine.

episodes.name: Just Donald and Me and Jerry Makes Three
episodes.overview: Ann and Donald get in the middle of Jerry and Ruth's troubled marriage to get them back together again.

episodes.name: The Seventh Time Around
episodes.overview: Don does a story on an old multimillionairess named Margaret ""Trixie"" Weatherby, and Ann thinks that she is trying to steal Don away from her.

episodes.name: Ann vs. Secretary
episodes.overview: Donald's sexy new secretary, Pat Crawford, arranges to accompany him on an out of town assignment to Washington, D.C., hoping to steal his heart from Ann. Feeling neglected and rejected, Ann decides she'll spare Don the pain of breaking up with her and she'll have it all done by the time he returns, so she returns all borrowed items of hers and Donald's to their proper apartments. But when she discovers she was wrong, she has only minutes to get everything back to normal before Don finds out.

episodes.name: Decision Before Dawn
episodes.overview: Ann is torn when everyone wants her to do different things with her expensive pay check.

episodes.name: Should All our Old Acquaintances be Forgot
episodes.overview: Ann and Donald want to ring in the New Year by themselves, but the arrival of Ann's parents for one quick drinks instantly turns their private celebration into a big party house.

episodes.name: The Homewrecker and the Window Washer
episodes.overview: When an aggresive bully collides with Ann in an office lobby, only nearby window washer, Rudy Clarn comes to her aid. But while warning him off, the bully slugs Rudy and breaks his nose. Feeling terribly guilty, Ann helps him to the doctor and then home. Rudy's wife, Ethel - a terribly jealous woman, believes there is more to the relationship between Ann and Rudy and threatens to leave him.

episodes.name: The Eye of the Beholder
episodes.overview: Ann receives a godawful art piece from Donald and gets a lot of different opinions about it.

episodes.name: Dark on Top of Everything Else
episodes.overview: Ann and Donald decide to take a little vacation from themselves, so Ann decides to move into her parent's house. Her parents are going on vacation, and she stays there. A noise gets her locked down in the basement and she is trapped. Her parents are worried when Ann doesn't answer the phone and they hurry back home to find that Donald has rescued her.

episodes.name: The Earrings
episodes.overview: On Valentine's Day, Ann and Donald exchange permanent gifts. She gives him a tie clasp and he gives her a pair of genuine diamond earrings they saw together at Tiffany's. Ann is scared to wear them. When Don puts his foot down and insists she wear them on their evening of dinner and dancing, one of them indeed disappears. Don buys her a replacement earring and puts it in her apartment. Ann, not wanting to disappoint Dan, buys a replacement earring herself.

episodes.name: Many Happy Returns
episodes.overview: Donald tries to help Ann out of an IRS mess but gets into a mess himself involving flour.

episodes.name: My Sister's Keeper
episodes.overview: Ann gets a job in another soda commercial, but she has to have her singing voice dubbed by someone else. Her voice double, Rose Cassinetti, helps Ann out and Ann tries to do something good for her. She doesn't know that Rose is a nun.

episodes.name: There Was a Time Ann Met a Pie Man
episodes.overview: Ann gets a job in a TV show. She is a pretty lady that gets hit by a pie. After the spot airs, she is embarrassed to death.

episodes.name: The Subject Was Rabies
episodes.overview: Lou gets bitten by a dog that follows Ann home and he thinks that he has caught rabies.

episodes.name: The Defiant One
episodes.overview: Ann befriends an African-American boy after saving him from a shoplifting charge. When he tells her he lives on Park Avenue, she does not believe him, so he invents a story of 13 brothers and sisters, fat rats, life in a dirty tenament, and a father who beats him. Appalled, Ann goes so far as to decide to adopt him! The boy then calls his father, who happened to be wealthy like he said earlier.

episodes.name: Fly Me to the Moon
episodes.overview: Ann lands a public relations job for the air force to promote women in the space program, at the time time she is supposed to help Donald wallpaper his apartment.

episodes.name: It's So Nice to Have a Mouse Around the House
episodes.overview: Ann calls Donald late one night because of a mouse in her apartment. Donald goes over to stay in her apartment to protect her. Of course, Lou comes by and finds Donald in Ann's apartment and decides that Ann and Donald should be married right away!

episodes.name: Bad Day at Marvin Gardens
episodes.overview: The Maries, Donald and Ann are playing a game of Monopoly and Lou gets very competitive.

episodes.name: Sue Me, Sue Me, What Can You Do Me?
episodes.overview: At the Newsview office, Lou slips on some water. Donald is told that Lou has to sign a waiver of responsibility. Donald goes to Mr. Prentice's office and quits, only to be talked back into his job by his managing editor.

episodes.name: Mission Improbable (1)
episodes.overview: While modeling at Unifit, Ann is hired to spy on a competitor who is suspected of stealing designs.

episodes.name: Mission Improbable (2)
episodes.overview: Unaware that her cover has been blown, Ann is tricked into photographing reject designs.

episodes.name: My Part Belongs to Daddy
episodes.overview: Ann is assigned to direct the Brewster annual play, but has to tell her father that he will not have the starring role.

episodes.name: Nobody Here But Us Chickens
episodes.overview: Ann gets a job as a dancing chicken for a fried chicken chain. The boss keeps trying to ""pluck"" her in his car, but Ann gets out of her car and gets stranded.

episodes.name: At the Drop of a Budget
episodes.overview: Ann goes to a dentist who uses hypnosis to calm people who are afraid down. When the dentist speaks to his wife on the phone while Ann is under hypnosis, the dentist tells his wife that she would buy anything at the drop of a hat and that EXACTLY what Ann does.

episodes.name: Hearing Today, Gone Tomorrow
episodes.overview: A hearing loss from a cold that Ann receives ruins a commercial spot for her.

episodes.name: The Snow Must Go On (1)
episodes.overview: Ann, her mother, her father and Donald are all stranded in a blizzard at Kennedy Airport. Ann is supposed to go to a Broadway audition and is determined to get there despite the weather.

episodes.name: Write is Wrong (2)
episodes.overview: Don writes a TV segment about the incident at Kennedy Airport if Ann agrees to be the star. Don is constantly bugged about rewrites and all that, and the whole thing turns out to be a mess. Thank god for pre-emption, Ann thinks when her show is supposed to be on.

episodes.name: Shake Hands and Come Out Acting
episodes.overview: Don is doing a story on a fighter who wants to be an actor.

episodes.name: Fix My Screen and Bug Out
episodes.overview: Ann tries to help out her neighbors in saving their hotel from the ownership of her ex-boyfriend.

episodes.name: Kiss That Girl Goodbye
episodes.overview: Don has a chance to go to Paris, but mulls about it when he thinks about how Ann will feel having to live without him.

episodes.name: She Didn't Have the Vegas Notion (1)
episodes.overview: Ann gets a job in a show in Las Vegas with an egotistical actor who tries to ruin her relationship with Donald.

episodes.name: She Didn't Have the Vegas Notion (2)
episodes.overview: Marty pulls a scheme to make it seem like Donald had married a starlet. Ann and Donald find out about the trick and decide to get Marty back by making it seem like Don is committing suicide.

episodes.name: I Am a Curious Lemon
episodes.overview: Ann has a dinner party, and one of Donald's now-married ex-girlfriends will attend. Ann tries to impress Heather, but the plans are ruined when her juvenile weekend guest plugs in a heater to warm up her lemon tree.

episodes.name: Ten Percent of Nothing is Nothing
episodes.overview: Ann joins her agent's comedy act in the Catskills, with disastrous results.

episodes.name: Opening Night
episodes.overview: Ann dreads bad reviews of her opening night in Broadway, and all this anxiety gets her finger trapped in a kitchen faucet.

episodes.name: That Meter Maid
episodes.overview: Ann relives her days as a meter maid when she meets Donald's new boss. As a meter maid, Ann tried to ticket the mayor's illegally parked car and was fired. Donald's new boss was the newspaper editor who printed Ann's letter of protest.

episodes.name: Fly By Night (1)
episodes.overview: Ann and Donald plan a trip to her father's cabin in Vermont. Donald's friend, Jon, flies them to the cabin in a small plane, but the plane makes an emergency landing after running out of gas.

episodes.name: Ugh, Wilderness (2)
episodes.overview: After determining Donald and Ann are okay, Jon goes to look for help. Ann and Donald start walking to keep warm and find a cabin. Ann's father gets nervous when they don't arrive on time and calls out a search party.

episodes.name: Stocks and the Single Girl
episodes.overview: Ann accidentally meets a stockbroker and he gives her his card. It seems that he has a list of products (his grocery list) on the back of the card, and Ann invests in the stock market.

episodes.name: The Night They Raided Daddy's
episodes.overview: Ann's father is losing business at his restaurant, so she hires a musical group to help bring business. The group she hires seem harmless enough, but when they perform, they do a Full Monty act!

episodes.name: The Reunion
episodes.overview: As class secretary-treasurer, Ann loses track of $360 she is to use for a high school reunion. Her father lends her the money, even though the party is to be at a rival restaurant. At the party, Ann watches three classmates she suspects of having taken the money.

episodes.name: Gone-A-Courtin'
episodes.overview: Ann has to go to court to help a producer win a lawsuit involving a shish-kabob skewer.

episodes.name: They Shoot Pictures, Don't They?
episodes.overview: Neighbor Ruth Bauman is strangely disinterested in a movie her husband is making with Ann and Donald. While viewing the film with Donald, Ann is shocked when she sees Ruth kissing another man in the background. Ann investigates to get the real story. It turns out that Ruth is pregnant and the man that she was kissing was her realtor because he found them a perfect place.

episodes.name: Easy Faller
episodes.overview: Donald hurts his back trying to demonstrate skiing in Ann's apartment, and worries about missing an interview. Ann brings the interviewee over to her apartment, and Lou comes over as well!

episodes.name: All's Well That Ends
episodes.overview: Don wants to take Ann out to the theater for her birthday, but she has to stay and babysit for a neighbor's child who has the mumps.

episodes.name: Counter Proposal
episodes.overview: After four years of dating, Donald finally asks Ann to marry him and presents her with an engagement ring - which he was talked into buying second-hand by a co-worker against his better judgement.

episodes.name: Donald, Sandi, and Harry and Snoopy
episodes.overview: Donald's sister Sandi has a passion for an actor, and he wants Ann to check up on him to see if he's a good man. The actor finds out what's going on and makes moves on Ann to teach her a lesson.

episodes.name: I Ain't Got Nobody
episodes.overview: A nude picture of Ann is plastered in a ""Playpen"" magazine, which jeopardizes her chance of being on a kiddie show.

episodes.name: No Man is Manhattan Island
episodes.overview: On a game show, Ann is asked to find out about her neighbors. No one wants to speak up, so Ann throws a party to invite everyone until her purse gets stolen.

episodes.name: Rattle of a Single Girl
episodes.overview: Ann and Donald go to a pre-nuptial counselor to weed out their non-existent problems.

episodes.name: There Sure Are a Bunch of Cards in St. Louis (1)
episodes.overview: Ann learns that killing two birds with one stone is almost too much when she goes to St. Louis with Donald to meet his parents and to star in a play. She is convinced that Don's mother hates her and decides that she might be able to turn it around if she were to have a larger, starring role in the play instead of her more modest part.

episodes.name: There Sure Are a Bunch of Cards in St. Louis (2)
episodes.overview: In St. Louis to appear in a play and meet Donald's parents, Ann once again finds that nothing is ever easy.

episodes.name: That Cake
episodes.overview: Ann lands the presitgious title of ""Miss New York has Everything"" and does a TV promotion for the city in which she bakes a fruit topped cheesecake using all New York ingredients. While baking the cake, Ann loses her ring in the cake batter, and to make matters worse, the cake has been shipped to New York Governor Nelson Rockefeller's house for a state dinner. After all the trouble they went to, Ann finds out that her ring wasn't even in the governor's cake!

episodes.name: That Girl's Daddy
episodes.overview: Lou feels as though he is getting too old, and Ann introduces him to Jeanie, who makes him feel more younger. Ann thinks that he is going to leave her mother when actually he wants to please her.

episodes.name: Stop the Presses, I Want to Get Off
episodes.overview: Ann is hired by a rival magazine because they think that Donald is going to help her out now that they are engaged.

episodes.name: Super Reporter
episodes.overview: Don is stuck in a ""super Don"" costume when his friends steal his clothes and forget to give them back to him. All before he is to accept an Humanitarian award from the deputy mayor!

episodes.name: That Senorita
episodes.overview: Ann gets a lesson in minorities when a sketch that she is in is very offensive to Mexicans.

episodes.name: An Uncle Herbert for All Seasons
episodes.overview: Uncle Herbert is turning Ann and Donald's world upside down when he makes bogus get-rich-quick schemes.

episodes.name: That Script
episodes.overview: Ann wants film rights to a novel, but the author will not sell. He changes his mind when he sees Ann, and how much she resembles his late wife. His new wife tells Ann that her husband can't write anymore and Ann turns down the movie out of respect for him.

episodes.name: Those Friars
episodes.overview: Ann's late Uncle Harry wills her an old trunk filled with bits and pieces of his career in vaudeville. Ann is doubly surprised when stars Milton Berle and Danny Thomaspay a visit to her apartment and try to buy the old trunk.

episodes.name: A Limited Engagement
episodes.overview: Donald breaks off his engagement to Ann because of cold feet.

episodes.name: The Russians are Staying
episodes.overview: Ann makes friends with a Russian named Nicholai who is a con man sponging off her.

episodes.name: That Shoplifter
episodes.overview: Ann is duped by a robber into shoplifting.

episodes.name: Chef's Night Out
episodes.overview: Ann and Donald try to run Lou's restaurant by themselves when the staff comes down with a virus.

episodes.name: That King
episodes.overview: Ann makes friends with a king, who turns out to be a kid!

episodes.name: Stag Party
episodes.overview: Donald's friends throw him a stag party - which almost costs him his engagement to Ann.

episodes.name: Two For the Money
episodes.overview: Ann gets a modeling assignment at Belmont Race Track and when Don's friends realize there's a horse running named for her, they see it as a ""sign"" and send her with the money to place a bet for them. She loses the ticket at the wrong time!

episodes.name: Soot Yourself
episodes.overview: As a member of an ecology-minded group, Ann is assigned to picket in front of the Newsview Magazine building where Donald works. Donald tries to make amends by inviting his boss to Ann's house for dinner.

episodes.name: The Elevated Woman
episodes.overview: On their way to the Women's Liberation meeting, which Donald reluctantly agrees to visit, Ann and Donald become trapped in a stuck elevator. While they await to be rescued, they look back on their favorite moments together.
